item.title: Lysne add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "[D]on't ever apologize to an author for buying something in paperback, or taking it out from a library (that's what they're there for. Use your library). Don't apologize to this author for buying books second hand, or getting them from bookcrossing or borrowing a friend's copy. What's important to me is that people read the books and enjoy them, and that, at some point in there, the book was bought by someone. And that people who like things, tell other people. The most important thing is that people read... " -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Lysne add a quote by Walter Cronkite
item.description: "Whatever the cost of our libraries, the price is cheap compared to that of an ignorant nation." -- Walter Cronkite

item.title: Lysne add a quote by Rita Mae Brown
item.description: "When I got [my] library card, that was when my life began." -- Rita Mae Brown

item.title: Lysne add a quote by Neil Gaiman
Lysne add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I don't believe in colleges and universities. I believe in libraries because most students don't have any money. When I graduated from high school, it was during the Depression and we had no money. I couldn't go to college, so I went to the library three days a week for 10 years." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Lysne add a quote by Catherynne M. Valente
item.description: "She sounds like someone who spends a lot of time in libraries, which are the best sorts of people." -- Catherynne M. Valente

item.title: Lysne add a quote by Harold Howe
item.description: "What a school thinks about its library is a measure of what it feels about education." -- Harold Howe

item.title: Lysne add a quote by E.B. White
item.description:
"A library is a good place to go when you feel unhappy, for there, in a book, you may find encouragement and comfort. A library is a good place to go when you feel bewildered or undecided, for there, in a book, you may have your question answered. Books are good company, in sad times and happy times, for books are people - people who have managed to stay alive by hiding between the covers of a book."
[<i>Letters of Note</i>; Troy (MI, USA) Public Library, 1971]" -- E.B. White
